inn1.comm: Young's first ball is just short of a good length, on off stump, and Chamu leaps up on his toes to keep his defensive shot down.
short again from Young, again Chamu is up on his toes but this time it's to cut the ball down to third man.
significant seam movement for Young! This jags back in off the track, and Chamu has to suck his tummy in as he leaves alone. Good wheels too.
quick again from Young, but the direction is lacking and the ball goes down the leg side.

gone! This was short and wide outside off, asking to be cut, but the extra pace meant Mutumbami couldn't control the stroke, and he's cut it straight to Porterfield at point. An early strike for Ireland!
Chari gets back and across to defend a rising delivery right under his eyes.
rising once again outside off stump, but this time Chari leaves alone.
Murtagh's first ball hits the seam and comes in to the right-hander, who meets it with crouching defence.
this one holds its line outside off, and it's also a little shorter from Murtagh, so Chamu is quite safe leaving alone.
an appeal for lbw! This one came in off the seam again, this time beating the bat and hitting Chamu on the pad. It looked high though, and Umpire Tiffin says no.
just short of a good length from Murtagh, and the batsman rides the bounce to tuck the ball into the leg side.
tip-and-run cricket brings a single. The important thing here was the placement - Chamu nudging this right between point and cover, with no great power. Chari called straight away.
Chari is off the mark now with a nudge off his hip, the ball rolling gently to square leg, but into space.
pace and carry for Young outside off stump. The batsman is in no danger though, and leaves well alone.
Young pushes his length a little fuller, perhaps looking for some swing, but he's flung this out too wide and is called.
that's the line, and the length. Young pushes this up close to the bat, and swings it away through the air. But again it's just a little too wide to get the batsman playing.
yet another leave from Chari, to a length delivery outside off. He seems a very patient young batsman.
ah, picture perfect defence from Chari now. Classical, with a high left elbow. It was needed too, as this ball was aimed right at the top of off stump.
Chari is back and across, forcing off the back foot, but he doesn't time the stroke and it bounces gently to point.
nicely quick from Young, and Chari's defence from the crease is somewhat hurried.
Chamu picks up the length quickly and sends a controlled pull out to deep square leg, where the fielder, Ed Joyce, runs around to cut it off.
much fuller from Murtagh, and Chibhabha defends off the front foot.
full and probing once more from Murtagh, the ball seaming in off the track towards middle and off.

canny bowling! Murtagh has done really well to set this dismissal up. The previous two deliveries came in off the seam, but this one just held its line outside off. Chamu pressed forward at it, but played the wrong line expecting seam movement. A feathered edge goes through to O'Brien, and Ireland celebrate.
Williams is off the mark straight away, leaning forward to caress a length delivery behind point.
watchful stuff from Chari, who walks across to cover a seaming delivery and defends to point.
there's a yelp of excitement from Wilson at first slip as ball passes bat! Williams pushed flat-footed from the crease at a delivery that left him off the pitch. Nothing on it.
Young keeps Williams honest with a bumper on middle and off. It's quick, but Williams is easily underneath it and ducking.
nudged off the hip for a single, Williams playing the ball behind square on the leg side.
Chari presents the full face of the bat as he drives, on the walk, to mid off. Straight to the fielder.
Young aims for a yorker, but the ball slips out as a full toss. Chari can't punish him though, driving straight to point.
and a probing delivery, full of length on middle and off, to end the over. Chari is forward in defence.
on a length, just outside off, and seaming away from the left-hander. Williams has a look and leaves it alone.

again Williams leaves alone, but this was too wide outside off and he's called by the Umpire. You can see what Ireland are trying to do, with Stirling at gully and these deliveries slanting across the left hander.
straighter this time from Murtagh, and Williams nudges him defensively to midwicket.
Murtagh reverts to his line outside off, but Williams won't be tempted and shoulders arms.
rising off a length outside off stump. Williams stands up to guide the ball to point.
edged! This was a genuine edge, but Williams is perhaps saved by his soft hands. The ball fell in front of Wilson at first slip.
Chari angles his bat outside off to find a single to third man.
shot! Young tests Williams with the short ball, but it sits up and he crunches a pull out to deep midwicket. Resounding shot off the bat.
a touch fuller, and straight from Young, and Williams defends from the crease.
smell that! A bristling bouncer from Young whistles past Williams' grille. The batsman did well to drop his hands under the ball.
Young's follow-up is a full ball on off stump, and Williams leans forward to push to cover.
an appeal for lbw, but it's an optimistic one. Young has found his outswinger when he pitches the ball full, and this one snaked in to hit Williams' pads. Clearly heading down the leg side.
Chari sets himself to glance to leg, but the ball rises past his bat and comes off the thigh pad. A single taken
full and wide outside off, and Williams drives to extra cover. Ireland still have a man at slip and another at a close gully position, so they'll want Williams to be driving.
just short of a good length, on off stump, and Williams forces to cover off the back foot.
well played. Williams didn't try to over hit this length delivery, just seized on the width outside off and made sure to place it right between the cover fielders. The timing did the rest.
Murtagh offers up a similar delivery, slightly closer to the off stump, but this time Williams steps across and shoulders arms.
full and straight from Murtagh, and Williams presses forward to defend.

a poor ball to start, and Chari heaves it out to deep square! Much to short from Dockrell, and it was headed down the leg side from around the wicket. Chari leaned back to hit it, and with only one fielder out on the leg side, he had plenty of space to aim for.
that's better. Dockrell loops a flighted delivery full just outside off to draw the batsman's defence.
flighted once more, and Chari stays deep in his crease to push to point.
the ball rushes on with the arm from around the wicket, taking the inside edge onto the pad and popping into the leg side.
fuller and straighter still, and Chari drives to mid on.
there's an appeal for lbw as Dockrell drifts another one in with the arm, and it looked like Chari was hit on the back leg. But the umpire was unmoved. Perhaps there was some bat involved.
Murtagh is testing Williams' patience here. Another length delivery is slanted across the left hander, but he leaves it alone.
slightly full of length outside off, and Williams drives - but straight to point
lovely little drive down the ground. Again, Williams doesn't put much flourish into the stroke, he just leans forward into a full ball and aims a checked drive down the ground.
Murtagh pulls his length back, taking the drive out of play, and Williams steps back and across to defend.
full and straight. Williams comes forward and drives to mid on.
Williams comes forward again to drive watchfully to mid on.
looped down on middle and off, and Chari stretches forward to defend.
slightly straighter, and Chari's bottom hand fetches the ball into the leg side. But straight to midwicket.
a toe-ended defensive push from the crease. The ball almost rolled back toward the stumps, but Chari stopped it with his foot as he played the stroke.
full outside off, and it's pushed back to the bowler.
lovely flight from Dockrell. He's giving the ball lots of air. Chari is well forward as he punches to extra cover.
nicely flighted once again, but Chari is firm in his defence. Good cricket all round.
O'Brien's first delivery is aimed at Williams' pads, and the left-hander picks up two runs through square leg.
floated down on a good length, just outside off. There's not much swing, and Williams crouches forward to defend to extra cover.
O'Brien pushes this one out a little wider, and Williams leaves well alone.
angled in to the left-hander, but Williams deals well with it, meeting the bat with a forward push to mid on.
tempting delivery, full and wide outside off. Williams stretches right across to it, has a good look, and opts to play no stroke.
just short of a good length outside off stump, but Williams' backfoot push goes straight to extra cover.
Chari comes forward and drives to long-off for a single.
a little short outside off stump from Dockrell, and Williams leans back to cut to the man at cover sweeper.
Test match stuff all round. Flight and guile from Dockrell, with men around the bat, and firm defence from Chari.
looped up on middle stump, and Chari tucks it quietly to mid on.
edged! But wide of Wilson at slip. The full ball, outside off, invited the stroke, and Chari had a drive at a ball that spun away from him to take the edge.
just short of that good length from Dockrell, and Chari steps back in his crease to defend back down the track.
Williams steps back in his crease and pulls this ball into the leg side, but straight Stirling at midwicket. It wasn't all that short, but he seemed to read the length well.
O'Brien pushes his line a little further outside off, from around the wicket, and Williams comes half forward to push the ball to point.
yet more width from O'Brien, and this time Williams threads the gap at cover with a punt off the back foot. O'Brien has cover in the deep, so just the one.
an odd little shot from Chari, a sort of front foot pull to a length ball outside off. The ball bounces straight to mid on.
fishing outside off! Chari has been undone by a quality delivery. This was the legcutter from O'Brien, and it jagged away off the pitch as Chari poked at it.
pushed fuller and wider outside off, but this time Chari covers his stumps and raises his arms to leave.

I'm not sure Williams meant to play this ball so late, or so fine, but he's picked up four. The ball was wide outside off, inviting a cut, but Williams dabbed down very late on it to beat Stirling at backward point. There's no one at third man, so it was four as soon as he hit it.
Dockrell responds by firing one in much flatter, and Williams flicks across his front pad to collect a single to the leg side.
Chari steps down the wicket to get to the pitch, and defends to cover.
Chari sweeps now, but the ball scoots past his bat to hit him on the pad. There's a stifled appeal from Wilson, but it was headed well down leg.
Chari steps forward this time to flick into the leg side, finding the gap between square leg and midwicket.
Williams almost looked as though he was done by the flight with this one, but he adjusts his defensive poke in time to keep a full ball out.
good shot for no runs. Chari is nicely balanced as he comes forward to drive a full ball, but the shot goes straight to Stirling at cover.
full and wide outside off, but not quite there to drive. Chari leaves alone.
edged! Chari threw himself into a backfoot slash, and the ball flew off a thick outside edge through a third or fourth slip position. Third man can't cut it off.
straighter this time from O'Brien, and Chari stands to defend from the crease.
watchful forward defence sends the ball bouncing towards extra cover.
sharp fielding from Porterfield at point! Chari connected well with this forcing stroke off the back foot, but Porterfield dived to his right to stop it cleanly.
short, and rising outside off stump. Williams rolls his wrists over a cut shot to collect a single into the deep
hurried defence from Chari! The delivery came back in at him and took the inside half of his defensive bat, rolling back down near the stumps before the batsman kicked it away.
another good shot for no reward from Chari. There was just a hint of width on this length delivery, and he punched it firmly, but straight to cover point.
past the outside edge now. Chari was looking to run the ball down to third man, but it climbed at him to beat the top edge.
Young targets a full-ish length just outside off, and Chari comes forward to push the ball out to the cover sweeper. He checked the stroke.
Williams keeps strike by driving out to the cover sweeper himself.
Williams brings up Zimbabwe's fifty with a dismissive pull to midwicket! I'm not sure O'Brien tried the short ball, he's got no cover out there. Firmly struck
a little fuller from O'Brien, but the line is towards Williams' pads and he hands the strike over with a flick to leg.
short and wide outside off, Chari leans back and thrashes a cut in the air, but safely in the gap, out to the cover sweeper.
Williams steps forward and across to meet the ball on the half volley, but drives straight to the man at cover.
driven hard back to the bowler, who picks the ball up in his follow through and threatens to throw down the stumps. Williams takes evasive action, and O'Brien gives him a good, long stare.
full again, and O'Brien drives it back to the bowler. No drama this time.
Young targets Chari with a bouncer, and though he beats his hook the ball is down the leg side, and called wide.
short again, and a hopping Chari defends the ball to point. He scampers out, looking for a single, but there's none to be had.
Chari is right behind a length ball to defend, dropping it under his eyes.
Young pushes his length up a little further, and Chari defends to extra cover. He's done well to deny Ireland, but his strike rate is in danger of slipping under 30 now.
Chari defends another length delivery into the covers.
nicely straight from Young, and Chari defends back down the track from the crease.
Young's line slips a little too close to leg stump, and Chari collects a single to midwicket to keep the strike.
he's bowled him first ball! Chari went really deep in his crease and aimed to punch this down the ground, but the ball ripped in through the gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps.
Chigumbura negotiates his first delivery well enough, staying in the crease and defending back down the track.
pushed defensively to extra cover.
Chigumbura is down the track now, and drives the ball hard back at McBrine, who sends him scampering back to his crease by threatening to throw the stumps down.
turned with the spin into the leg side.
another big offspinner, and Chigumbura glances it straight to the square leg fielder.
neatly worked off the pads, and a single for Williams through square leg.
Chigumbura goes back and across to nudge to mid on.
Dockrell draws the batsman forward with flight, and the ball is defended back down the track.
Elton comes down the track, and drives to cover.
not the most fluent looking start for the Zimbabwean captain. This was short and wide outside off, but he's clanged it to cover with zero timing.
pushed defensively into the covers off the front foot, and Chigumbura remains on zero.
Williams, meanwhile, seems to be seeing the ball quite well now. This flighted delivery is chipped into the gap between long on and deep midwicket, and they're back for an easy two.

dropped at deep midwicket! Williams swept hard, but in the air towards Young in the deep ... he seemed to run in a little too far and then had to jump backwards, and ended up palming the ball over the ropes.
more watchful from Williams, defending to the bowler.
defended to extra cover this time.
no holding back on this stroke! Williams came down the track and heaved into the leg side, again picking the gap between the fielders out there.
Williams leans back to look for a cut, but the shot goes nowhere.
Chigumbura comes half forward and defends into the leg side.
finally Chigumbura is off the mark, cracking a short delivery out to the cover sweeper.
eased through cover point by Williams, another one to the total.
Chigumbura spotted the line of this delivery, Dockrell having speared it towards leg stump, but perhaps tried to hit it too hard and ended up swiping over the top of the ball.
Chigumbura comes down the track and gets the ball on the half volley to drive to long off.
Williams cuts, but he finds the man at backward point.
nice use of the feet from the Zimbabwean captain, as he skips out and gets very close to the delivery before driving to long on.
Williams is also down the track, but he can't get quite to the pitch and he defends.

well played. The ball wasn't all that bad, but it spun away from Williams, creating width, and he waited on the ball before punching it out through extra cover off the back foot. He hit it well enough to beat the man at cover sweeper.
driven back down the ground, the bowler tumbles over it but can't stop the ball.
turned with the spin in front of square on the leg side, the man in the deep cleans up.
speared in quite flat by McBrine, and Williams punches to extra cover off the front foot.
Chigumbura goes very deep in his crease to this ball on middle and off, and then threads the gap at cover for a single.
dabbed down quite late, but straight to backward point.
wrong line from Dockrell, the ball spinning down the leg side, and Williams just has to lay bat on it for an easy single.
is Dockrell struggling with the left/right combination? This is arrowed down the leg side, and pulled out to long leg for two.
Chigumbura attempts to force off the back foot, but the ball is toe ended straight down into the pitch.
the right-hander comes down the track to meet the ball on the full, driving to long off for one.
short and wide outside off, and Chigumbura leans way back to cut out to the cover sweeper.
looped down on middle and leg by McBrine, the batsman coming forward to push the ball back to the bowler.
a sliced cut off the back foot is well stopped by the point fielder.
for the first time today, Williams unfurls the reverse sweep - but it goes straight to Young at short third man.
Williams waits for the ball to turn and eases a single through backward point.
this was quite full from McBrine, but Chigumbura waited on the back foot before pushing to midwicket. He hits the field, and there's no run.
Williams goes to fifty by flicking a leg-side delivery out to deep midwicket. That's his first fifty since New Zealand were here in August.
a touch short from Stirling, and Chigumbura creates with by stepping way back to leg, hacking the ball out to the cover sweeper.
flat-batted to the left of the man at cover, well stopped.
a touch short, and Williams pulls out into the deep.
pushed out through cover off the back foot again.
gone! Williams departs. Was he distracted by his sore knee? He tried to late cut this ball, but edged it straight into the keeper's gloves.
flighted full and straight, Chigumbura pushes it back to the bowler.
use of the feet creates a half volley, and Chigumbura drives to long off.
nicely flighted outside off stump. Raza thinks about coming down the track, but then keeps his back foot in the crease and defends.
off the mark in style! This time Raza does skip out, and his drive beats a diving Stirling at extra cover.
again Raza is down the track, but this time he pings the fielder at long off for a single.
Chigumbura comes forward to defend to leg, but the ball comes off the inside edge of his bat to keep McBrine interested.
nicely driven, on the walk, but the ball is well stopped by Kevin O'Brien at extra cover.
hurled down the leg side, from around the wicket, and as Niall O'Brien fumbles the take they're allowed to run another one.
short outside off. The ball doesn't spin in much, and Chigumbura sends it out to deep cover with a wristy cut.
looped up outside off, from around the wicket, and Raza presses forward to defend.
leg side line again from Stirling, but this time Raza gets bat on it, glancing to the man at short fine leg.
pushed back down the track to the bowler, off the back foot.
Raza lunges down the track, stretching his left leg out to smother the ball defensively back to the bowler.
twirled down on a middle and off line, from around the wicket. Chigumbura defends
a drive this time from the Zimbabwean captain, and long off trots around to keep them to one.
Raza stays deep in his crease and forces off the back foot, aiming his shot straight at Stirling at extra cover.
a bottom-handed drive gets the ball down to long off for one.
Chigumbura follows suit, driving down the ground to bring up the Zimbabwean hundred.
Raza is forward, and drives back to the bowler.
a touch too short, and Chigumbura collects a single through square leg.
one more to the total, driven to cover.
again Chigumbura gets back and across to change the angle of the ball and ease it through the leg side for one.
Raza gets down on one knee and hacks down on a full, wide ball to get a single out into the deep.
an appeal for LBW as ball strikes pad, but it's pitched outside leg, from around the wicket, by the looks of things.
eased down to long off for one more.
arrowed down flat and fast, from around the wicket, and it's flicked off the pads into the leg side field.
Chigumbura jumps down the pitch to get to the ball on the half volley, driving to long off.
Raza stretches down the pitch to defend back to the bowler.
more defence, this time to extra cover.
another defensive stroke, but this time he angled the bat cleverly to thread the gap at cover point.
pushed back down the track at the bowler.
flight, drift and turn for Stirling tests Raza's defence outside off.
well, he just tried to over hit this one. The ball was a little short, but it scuttled through low to beat Raza's almighty heave to leg.
pushed softly to extra cover.
dabbed down just wide of point, and they rush through for one.
Chigumbura forces off the back foot, but finds point.
eased down the ground for a single.
McBrine continues to operate from around the wicket, and Chigumbura's drive is stopped by the man at straight midwicket.
Elton shimmies down the track and drives to long off.
good running. Raza seized on some width to cut the ball out to the right of the man at cover sweeper, and they pushed hard for the second.
turned to straight midwicket with plenty of bottom hand.
Raza flicks his wrists over this delivery, which was slightly short on leg stump, to pick the gap at square leg.
a little too short and wide from McBrine, and Chigumbura has the space to force the ball out through extra cover.
Chigumbura's bat comes down quite late in defence, but he does enough to keep it out.
not much flight from the bowler, and Chigumbura defends a quick one off his pads.
pushed to extra cover off the back foot.
driven back to the bowler this time.
Young's first delivery is full outside off, and Raza - who has a helmet on now - comes forward to drive him to extra cover.
Young offers some width outside off, and Raza clears his left leg to hack the ball through extra cover for a brace.
great connection on the shot from Raza, the ball pinging right out of the middle of his backfoot punch, but his placement sends it straight to extra cover.
up and over the slip! Raza flung everything at this short ball outside off, and seemed to deliberately uppercut it, though he probably wasn't aiming to hit it so fine. The ball beats third man
and now the batsman is beaten, on the inside edge, by some movement back in off the track from outside off. Cracking delivery.
Young pushes his final delivery wide of off stump, and it's left alone.
nicely swept by Chigumbura. The shot was on, with McBrine coming around the wicket, but he placed it perfectly to beat the man at long leg.
another sweep from Chigumbura, but this one isn't hit quite as well and long leg cleans up.
play and a miss outside off! Chigumbura aimed to swipe this through extra cover, but the ball rushed past him.
Chigumbura comes down the track and drives to long on.
well placed by the batsman, flicking a spinning delivery off his pads and out to the left of the man in the deep to allow two.
driven down the ground for a single to end the over.
well, Porterfield brought mid-on up and Raza has chipped the ball straight over Stirling's head there. The ball was short, but he went at it with a strong forehand.
shot! Raza brings up the fifty partnership with a scooped drive that flies over mid off and bounces just once before the rope.
Young offers another delivery outside off, but it's not quite as full and Raza leaves it alone.
chopped down to the man at point.
very nicely played by Raza, who waited on the ball outside off and flicked down on it at the very last moment to find a single to third man.
Young fires down a quick yorker, and it's dug out back down the ground. The bowler can't stop it, and there's time for a single before mid-off gets around.
just short of a good length on middle stump. Chigumbura leans over it and the ball rolls slowly back to the bowler.
swing and a miss outside off! Murtagh offered width, but the ball was past Chigumbura even as he played the shot.
Murtagh counters Chigumbura's shimmy down the track by sending down a quick bouncer which almost has the Zimbabwe captain down on his rump.
another big shot outside off stump, this time the ball takes the inside edge and rolls into the leg side, allowing a single.

almost a run out! Raza tapped the ball into the covers and both batsmen wandered out, looking for a single. Chigumbura wandered out a little further, and by the time Raza sent him back Stirling was already swooping down at the ball. His throw hit the stumps directly, but Chigumbura dived in time to save himself.
driven down the ground for a single to end the over.

and he's immediately hit for six! Raza came down and had a full swing, but O'Brien down at long on was very interested in the shot ... but the ball had just enough on it to get over him as he leapt at the boundary's edge.
again Raza uses his feet, but this time drives along the ground through cover.
a touch short outside off, but Chigumbura's cut is stopped at point.
a huge slog sweep from Chigumbura, but he's not come close to hitting the ball. Off the pad into the leg side.
driven down the ground now for a single.
Raza steps back to chop a cut into the covers, and as it bounces past the fielder they take a single.
the offcutter? Perhaps. It was slower in the air, and came in off the pitch to draw Raza's defence.
and there's another one! A brave shot from Raza, who shuffled right across and then paddle-scooped a full ball right back over Niall O'Brien's head.
a sliced cut is stopped cleanly by Porterfield at point.
on a length, and straight. Raza flicks off his hip

now what's happened here? Chigumbura jumped down the track and slammed a drive in the air towards Balbirnie at long off. The fielder ran around, caught it just before the ropes, and then managed to maintain his balance and not fall over them. But he was so close to the boundary marker that it's touch and go, and Chigumbura waits at the wicket to receive confirmation that he''s out. There's no television replay, but the Umpires are happy with what they saw, and the fielder's word, and give him out. Shades of that catch by Mooney at the World Cup, though in far less heated circumstances ...
Mutombodzi meets his first ball, a full one outside off, with a bottom-handed flick of a drive that sends the ball back to the bowler.
slanting in with the arm from outside off, and Dockrell's line is good enough to cramp Raza for room.
a little too wide this time, and Raza cuts out to deep cover.

caught behind! Or is he? No, says the umpire. The ball was short and well wide, and Tino thrust the bat out at it. Dockrell immediately thought he'd got his man, and set off down the wicket in celebration, but the umpire says not out. It's umpire Cloete.
turned into the leg side, and they take a single.
nicely placed! Raza aims leg side with his glance, and finds space wide of long on to allow for a rushed second run.
and there's his fifty now. Raza gets to the mark with a punt down the ground to long on. A vital innings as Zimbabwe look to get past 200.
full and straight. Raza sends it into the leg side with plenty of bottom hand, but his shot finds the man inside the circle at midwicket.

oh dear, this is a horrid shot. Raza skipped down the track to a length delivery and then aimed a wild slog across the line at it. He was nowhere near it, and his head was high as he swung right over the ball, which clattered into the stumps directly.

oh, a fancy little shot from Jongwe to start. He waited and waited on a length delivery outside off, and then dabbed down on it. Young sprinted around from third man, and put in the dive, but he couldn't quite stop it.
Murtagh aims straighter this time, and Jongwe must defend to cover.
driven back down the track. The bowler tumbles in his follow through as he tries to stop it, but he can't get his hand down in time and they steal a single.
he's picked up the length well here, scooping a pull out to deep midwicket. A sprinted two adds to the total.

run out! This is fantastically sharp work from Dockrell. Jongwe flicked to leg, but the ball didn't get far and Dockrell himself sprinted across at it. Mutombodzi, at the non-striker's end, wanted a single and rushed out, but Jongwe sent him back. Rightly so, as he'd never have made it. Dockrell was across in a flash and shattered the stumps with a bullet throw.
chopped down behind point, and the batsmen charge through for the first three of the game. Good placement, and good running.
Dockrell comes round the wicket to the left-handed Masakadza, the batsman glancing straight to square leg.
Masakadza sweeps right over the top of a darted delivery, and fortunately for him it's wide of off
another missed sweep, this time the ball is slightly straighter and it loops up off the pad.

another run out! Masakadza turned the ball to leg, and called for a run that was never there. Again it was Dockrell's fielding that sealed the dismissal - he sprinted around to midwicket and aimed a perfect throw to Niall O'Brien, who whipped the bails off with the batsman well short.
Murtagh spears down a full ball on leg stump, beating the batsman's attempted leg glance.
now, that's too far down leg from Murtagh, a clear wide

there goes another one! Wellington was trying to clear the infield, who had been brought in as Ireland attacked the tail. He got a full ball on off stump, but sliced right underneath it and Kevin O'Brien settled easily under the chance at mid-off.
very full and shaping in to middle stump, it's defended back down the track.
Nyumbu chops down on a delivery outside off to collect a single to third man. Murtagh briefly thought he was in business.
just short of a good length, and a little too straight as well, allowing Muzarabani to angle the ball behind square on the leg side for one.

a sloppy end to the over from Niall O'Brien allows a bye. Nyumbu fiddled at a rising delivery outside off but didn't get anything on it. O'Brien then gloved the ball to leg, and an alert Muzarabani called his partner through.
hurled down short, but also down the leg side to give Zimbabwe one more.
angled down to third man for one, and there are ironic cheers from the small crowd gathered to watch this final game.

overthrows now. Ireland are relaxing a little in the field. Muzarabani guided a short ball to point, but they weren't really looking for the single. But there was a shy at the stumps, and it's not backed up.
appeal for lbw! This looked fairly adjacent. Perhaps it's hit him just outside off stump. Not given.
another length delivery, but this one is a little too straight and it's glanced past midwicket.
a play and a miss to a rising delivery outside off stump.
dug out down the ground, and mid-on trots in to keep the batsmen at home.
seaming in off a full, probing length. Nyumbu leans forward to defend, and Muzarabani comes down the wicket for a word of encouragement.
slightly fuller this time, and Nyumbu drives to long on.
slightly ungainly defence to a length delivery on middle stump. The ball trickles back down the wicket.
Murtagh aims for a yorker, and though it slips out as a full toss Muzarabani's drive isn't timed and the ball is stopped by Stirling at extra cover.
full of length, outside off, and the ball seems to keep a little low as Muzarabani hurries to get his bat down on it in time.
now Murtagh finds the yorker, but the batsman is able to dig it out into the leg side.
nasty delivery. It spits up of a short length and Nyumbu fends it in the air towards square leg.
Muzarabani flashes outside off, but the ball was past him before he'd played the shot. Play and miss.
rising from middle and leg, Muzarabani gets up on his toes to defend to cover.
now the tailender jumps out like Trumper and aims to smite the ball into the heavens. Alas, he doesn't get near to it. There's an appeal for caught behind, but it's rather fanciful.
attempted yorker from Young, but it slips down the leg side and Muzarabani glances to fine leg.
one more to the total, Nyumbu turning a straight ball towards midwicket for a single.
a touch short, and it's clubbed into the leg side - but straight to the man in the deep.
got him! O'Brien ends the innings by pinging Muzarabani's pads with a full, straight delivery.

inn2.comm: good start for Muzarabani. His first ball is on a probing length just outside off, and Porterfield leaves it well alone. Pace and carry through to the keeper
Muzarabani goes wide on the crease for his second ball, but the change of angle gives Porterfield width outside off and he's off the mark with a backfoot punch for two
much too full, and Porterfield slams a long half volley through the covers for four this time
and again! The off-side field had been reinforced after that last shot, but it makes no difference. Porterfield leans into a full-blooded drive for another boundary

now the third man boundary is peppered! Again Muzarabani went full and wide, again Porterfield threw himself into the drive. This time it's a thick edge, but it goes fine of third man for four. Oh dear, and he's over-stepped as well, so the next delivery is a Free Hit
Muzarabani destroys Porterfield's stumps, the batsman swinging wildly at a straight one, but it means nothing as it was a Free Hit. And they take a run as well
flicked off the pads, and they rush back for two before the fielder can haul it back in
just short of a good length on a leg stump line, and Porterfield clips through square leg for one
good delivery, slightly full length and just outside off, but not there to drive. Stirling defends to cover
a touch straighter this time, and Stirling stands at the crease to defend back down the track
Jongwe seams this one in off the track, and Stirling turns it to midwicket - but straight to the fielder

top shot, but it doesn't quite have the legs to reach the boundary. Stirling kept his elbow nice and high as he aimed this drive through the gap between midwicket and mid-on, and they sprint through for three
and a good end to the over. Jongwe shoots this length delivery across Porterfield's bows, and beats his outside edge
a better start to this over from Muzarabani, he hits a length on middle and off and Stirling leans forward to defend
the ball pings right out of the middle of the bat as Stirling leans forward to drive, but he picks out Chamu at extra cover
a play and a miss! This delivery held its line where the others had jagged in, and zipped past Stirling's blade as he flashed outside off
a little straighter from Muzarabani now, and Stirling's defence goes to Raza at midwicket
flicked elegantly off the hip by the right-hander, and Jongwe rushes in from fine leg to keep them to the single
Muzarabani, wary of feeding Porterfield outside off stump, strays onto his legs and is clipped down to fine leg for one
Jongwe aims for the top of Porterfield's off stump, but the ball is met with solid defence
driven uppishly! Porterfield's eyes lit up with a full length delivery, and he slashed wildly at the ball. Fortunately for him, it bounced well short of the extra cover fielder
Jongwe pulls his length back, and Porterfield props half forward to defend to mid off
the left-hander angles his bat at a delivery outside off stump, collecting a single to third man
Stirling glances a straight, length delivery watchfully to the man at midwicket. As Jongwe walks back to his mark, he practices a rather more aggressive version of the same stroke

up and over cover! Vintage Stirling, this. He stepped down the track and also made room to go inside out over cover, checking the shot but getting a superb connection. One bounce four over extra cover
Porterfield is cramped a little for room by this delivery, defending it away from his stomach with a jab
nicely straight from Muzarabani again, and Porterfield pushes defensively back down the track
well played. It wasn't quite the half volley on leg stump, but Porterfield just leaned over the ball and threaded the gap between mid on and midwicket for two
crunched to cover off the back foot
nicely bowled, right up to the bat on middle and off. Porterfield crouches forward to defend
and a quiet end to the over, Porterfield hopping up on his toes to defend a back of a length delivery into the covers
Jongwe sprints in and hurls one down on a length, Stirling walking into a defensive stroke

celebration from the bowler, but nothing from the umpire! Jongwe fired this one down the leg side, and it definitely hit something as it went past Stirling. Mutumbami held onto the ball while diving, and Jongwe thought he had his man. But it's come off his pad
a touch too full from the bowler, outside off stump, but Stirling's drive goes straight to mid off
Stirling jumps down the track now, but Jongwe might just have seen him coming and fires down a yorker on leg stump. As it's dug out to cover, the bowler gives the batsman a glare
on a length and scooting in off the seam. Stirling stands at the crease to defend
ouch, he's struck him a midships! Stirling set himself for a front-foot pull, but he swiped past the ball and it stung him. He adjusts his protective gear and gets on with it, minimum fuss

that's a stunning effort! Porterfield flung himself into a full-blooded drive to a half volley, but he smeared the ball in the air towards extra cover. Raza was in the position, but he had to leap up very high and time his jump just right too. He holds a stinging chance above his head, in mid-air, and Zimbabwe converge on the bowler
Muzarabani flings down a length delivery on middle and off, and Joyce meets it with a late defensive jab
much fuller this time, but Joyce doesn't have a full go at it and the ball pops up to be fielded by Chamu in the covers
on a length and straight. Joyce stays in the crease to nurdle the ball into the leg side
very wide indeed outside off. He's almost missed the cut strip and it's called a wide
that's much better. Muzarabani bowls a wicket to wicket line on a good length, and Joyce defends into the leg side
off the edge, but the ball goes down well to Nyumbu's left at first slip and bounces down to the third man boundary
driven hard, the ball making a resounding crack as it comes off the bat, but Chamu Chibhabha kneels down to stop it at cover
driven straight back down the ground, but Waller charges around from mid on and gets half a hand to it to take the sting out of the shot, just the one run
much too wide outside off, and he's called by the umpire
Jongwe bends his back with this one, and Joyce has to stand up tall to defend it back down the track
this one is also on a length, just outside off, and Joyce lets it through with no shot
left alone once again by the batsman, the line harmlessly outside off
Joyce leans forward into a drive, but he can't quite get it through the gap and Waller tumbles over to cut it off
Joyce comes forward and clubs a drive into the covers with plenty of bottom hand. Raza scoots across to cut it off
a shade fuller this time, and aimed straighter at off stump. Joyce defends to backward point
clipped off the pads into the leg side, but straight to midwicket
Joyce aims a neat little dab at a rising delivery outside off, guiding it cleanly down to third man
driven firmly into the off side off the front foot, and Chamu falls to his left to stop it
Stirling looks for the gap at square leg, but the ball just seems to stop on him a little bit and it dribbles slowly to Raza at midwicket instead
Joyce comes forward and bends down on one knee to drive. It looks a good shot, but it's not well timed and Chibhabha stops it easily in the covers

this is stopped again by the same fielder, but not quite so easily! Joyce connected the second drive much better, and Chamu had his hand stung as he cut it off. They steal a single as Waller cleans up
past the outside edge! Jongwe generally seams the ball in, and can also swing it away. This was the latter, and Stirling played right inside it
and again! Where the previous stroke from the batsman was a defensive one, this time he's on the attack outside off. But the result is the same - play and miss
three in a row. This time Jongwe sent down the bouncer outside off, and it rushed past Stirling's attempted pull

uppish, but four and that's what counts. Jongwe aimed one at the batsman's pads, and Stirling responded with a whip to leg. Though he hit it in the air, there's acres of room to the right of the midwicket fielder, and the ball can't be chased down
full outside off stump, and Joyce leans into a square drive, the ball bouncing up to be stopped by the point fielder
straighter from Muzarabani, and Joyce patiently defends the length delivery back down the track
a bottom edged cut to a ball rising outside off goes straight to ground and then bounces up to be easily stopped by Masakadza at point
Muzarabani goes full and straight again, and Joyce defends off the front foot
Joyce comes half forward again to tap the ball softly to cover point. This has been a nicely consistent over from the bowler
and he's bowled a maiden. A good length delivery on middle and off is met with a dead bat

this could have been a run out! Stirling punched the ball to Raza at cover, and he stopped, turned and threw in one fluid motion. Wellington caught the ball in front of the stumps, but then missed them completely as he tried to break the wicket! I reckon Stirling would have been well short as well.
cut very late by the left hander, but it's stopped by Chigumbura at short third man
Joyce skips out, and across to the off side, but his flick to leg goes straight to the man at midwicket inside the circle

caught in the deep! There's only one man out on the leg side, and Joyce has picked him out with a slog sweep. His connection was good, but not nearly good enough, and Chari caught it about three metres inside the boundary. It's a short boundary too, as they're playing on the pitch on the far Western side of the square
off the mark with ease. The field had been brought in for the new batsman, but his first delivery is a wide half volley and he crashes it through the covers
driven to cover once again, but this time he picks out a fielder
the bowler is fortunate to get away with this! The ball is darted down the leg side, and Stirling had the freedom for a range of strokes, but he taps it straight to the short fine leg fielder
whipped to Raza at midwicket inside the circle
big spin on this one, starting well outside off and going down the leg side. It clips the batsman's pad, so not a wide
just short of Waller at short fine leg! Stirling swept, and it went in the air. Waller put in a valiant effort, diving forward, but the ball died just in front of him
turned with the spin into the leg side
yet again Nyumbu twirls one down the leg side, but he's not fully punished by the batsman, whose sweep is stopped by the deep square leg fielder
Stirling stays deep in his crease to punch off the back foot, and a diving Raza at cover can't quite cut it off. They amble through for a single as long off runs in
fuller, straighter, and it's defended back down the wicket
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot once again
Masakadza fires down a quicker one, and Balbirnie cuts it straight to Chari at backward point
punched to Raza at extra cover
a drive is sliced uppishly, but it drops several metres in front of Raza at extra cover and there's no hard done

chipped in the air, but into space! Stirling came down the track but he didn't get close to the pitch of the ball, which turned and bounced on him. Fortunately it lands safely and wide long on runs in to stop it
whipped off the hip through square leg for one
Nyumbu spins one past Stirling's booming slog sweep, and he's struck on the thigh outside off
too short outside off, and the ball is cut out past the point fielder
nicely bowled this time, the ball dipping in front of the batsman as he lunges forward to defend
Chari at backward point gets a palm to another cut shot, saving a couple of runs. But as he can't stop it cleanly, there's a single
Balbirnie thrusts his bat out in defence, and the ball comes off the inside half of it, rolling to midwicket
a little too short, and Balbirnie pulls one under a diving Waller at midwicket. They're back for the third as the ball is pulled in short of the rope
Masakadza comes round the wicket, and Stirling turns him to midwicket against the spin
full outside off, and it's driven to long off for one
lunging forward defence from Balbirnie, smothering the spin
and defended back down the track once more to end the over
a premeditated sweep from Stirling, but he can't beat Waller at short fine leg
glanced this time, but again it goes to short fine. Nyumbu seems to be bowling to a plan here
very straight again from the bowler, and spinning towards leg stump. Stirling sweeps out to the man at deep square
poor bowling, and equally bad keeping. There was turn and bounce, to be sure, but the ball pops out of Mutumbami's gloves and they add to the extras
turned with the spin into the leg side
defended back down the track
Balbirnie waits on a delivery that lands well outside off, spinning in, and tucks it to backward point
very full, and driven back to the bowler
beaten on the cut! This was too full for the stroke, and the ball has zipped under Stirling's bat
full and straight, and it's pushed back down the track
watchful defence once more from Stirling, Masakadza fielding off his own bowling
turned off the pads into the leg side, straight to midwicket
and Stirling drives one at the mid on fielder to end the over
nicely bowled, flighted on off stump and the ball spins in sharply. Defended to leg.
turned with the spin into the leg side again, straight to Raza at midwicket.
nudged back down the track at the bowler.
that's a cracking shot! Classical stuff from Balbirnie, who just leans into the half volley outside off and caresses it through cover.
this isn't quite as elegant. Indeed, Balbirnie looks quite ungainly as he hacks it back to the bowler.
nurdled off the pads, with the spin, into the leg side.
a big shot from Stirling, and the ball goes miles up in the air! Mid on was up, but it's long-off who sprints around and manages to parry the ball back into play as it bounces near the ropes.
tapped back down the track at the bowler.
much too short outside off, and Stirling steps back to carve the ball over extra cover.
he's down the track again, but the ball skews off the leading edge and bounces into the covers.
Stirling defends to mid on, eyes right over the ball.
poor bowling with no one out in the deep. It's short and wide, and Stirling slashes through the cover field for four more.
Balbirnie stretches forward to defend to extra cover.
and now he drives, but again finds the extra cover fielder.
nudged in front of mid-on, and there's time for a single as Chigumbura runs in from the edge of the circle.
turned with the spin to Raza at midwicket
nice placement, Stirling opening the bat face at the last moment to find the gap at cover point for a quick single.
Balbirnie leans forward and flicks to leg, but he finds a busy Raza at midwicket inside the circle.
well, he can still turn the ball. This one fizzes away from the right-hander, who leaves it alone outside off.
this time Balbirnie sticks his bat out to late cut, but he finds Chigumbura at a deep backward point.
once again Chigumbura is into the action to stop another late cut.
spinning away outside off, and it's left alone. He's close to being called for a wide with that one.
a quicker one from Mutombodzi, much flatter through the air, and he's swept out to deep square.
driven down to long-off for one.
defended solidly back down the track.
turn and bounce for Nyumbu, the ball taking the inside edge and ricocheting off the hip, but falling safely in front of short fine leg.
an appeal for lbw! Sharp spin beats the inside edge as Balbirnie comes forward. He's possibly struck outside the line, and it's not given.
chopped down into the covers. Chamu gets a hand to it, and they steal a single.
swept hard out to long leg, where there's a man to stop it.
an angled bat gets the ball to backward point for no run.
a toe-ended sweep goes out to deep midwicket, in front of square.
Balbirnie punches through cover, beating two diving fielders there, to collect runs
slashed in the air now, up and over cover, the ball falling well short of the fielder on the boundary.
Stirling sweeps, but the ball rushes past him outside off and Mutumbami collects.
nicely on target from Mutumbami, and Stirling defends.
sturdy forward defence ends the over.

there's no stopping Raza in the field! Balbirnie turned the ball into the leg side, and hit it rather well, but Raza put in a dive from his position at midwicket to cut it off. The batsmen had called for the run, and as Raza stood up he was side on from the wicket, with one stump to aim it. His throw was arrowed directly onto that stump to catch the batsman short, and he breaks the partnership two short of fifty.
and now there's an lbw appeal from the bowler! Stirling missed his sweep and was struck on the pad, but he was well outside off stump.
Stirling comes forward to a flighted offspinner, driving it watchfully to cover.
a touch shorter from Nyumbu, but not a bad ball at all and Stirling defends.
paddled down very fine towards fine leg, and they rush back for the second.
Nyumbu twirls one down on off stump to end the over, Stirling stepping forward to defend
O'Brien steps right across to the off side and clips the ball with the spin, but a diving fielder at midwicket cuts it off. Guess who?
flicked with the spin, and again Raza is in to stop it.
Raza is being given a lot of work to do, again he's across to field a ball turned into the leg side.
a quicker one, just outside off, and O'Brien chops it to backward point.
defended into the covers.
slapped hard off the front foot. The man at cover can't get around in time, and long-off trots in to keep them to one.
and immediately Stirling charges down the wicket at him, aiming to slash the ball over extra cover. But his shot is a little too wild, and it goes past the outside edge.
on a length, and angling in off the seam. This time Stirling defends from the crease.
Stirling brings his bat down in an angled arc to guide the ball to the right of the third man fielder.
ah, a little more vim and vigour in this delivery! Muzarabani bends his back and a quick ball bursts past O'Brien's defensive edge at chest height.
past the edge once more, but this time O'Brien was aiming to cut.
bat on ball to end the over, O'Brien pressing half forward and pushing to cover point.

Stirling sweeps, and telegraphs his intentions as he does so. An alert Nyumbu at slip was already charging to a leg slip position, but Stirling missed the sweep and the ball popped out of Mutumbami's gloves on the leg side.
driven hard into the covers, and for once Raza can't stop it cleanly.
Mutombodzi gets one to grip outside off stump, the ball spinning past Stirling's defensive poke.
too wide this time from the bowler, and Stirling has plenty of time to lean back and cut out to the cover sweeper.

a wicket for the part-timer! Niall O'Brien charged down the track, and with mid-off up he was aiming to go over the off side field. But he couldn't get the required height on the shot, nor the timing, and Chamu Chibhabha moved quickly to his right from cover to hold a catch at waist height.
Wilson aims a sweep at his very first delivery, but the ball pops and spins to beat him.
on a length, and angling in from off stump. Stirling defends back down the track.
a touch fuller this time, and it draws the drive from the batsman. But the shot goes straight to Chari at mid-on.
I'm not sure if Muzarabani held this one back, or it stopped on the pitch, but Stirling's attempted flick to leg instead sends the ball to cover point off the leading edge. No harm done.
a bouncer from Muzarabani, a real effort ball and he grunts loudly as he lets it go. It's not all that quick, but it beats Stirling's swift pull to leg and goes through to the keeper.
this has definitely kept low, on middle and leg. Stirling stoops to defend into the leg side, getting his bat down in time.
full and wide outside off, and Stirling bends down low again to collect a single to third man.
a touch too straight, and it's turned into the leg side for one.
looped up full outside off stump, and the ball is driven to extra cover.
wide again, and inviting the drive. The ball is spooned to backward point, with a couple of bounces along the way.
swept this time, and he finds enough space at short fine leg for a quick single.
looped up invitingly outside off. Stirling waits and waits, and then cuts, but straight to Chigumbura at backward point.
a quicker one now, aimed at middle stump, and Stirling shovels it into the leg side for one.
indeed, this first ball does seem to keep low outside off. Stirling set himself at the crease for a mow into the leg side, but the ball zipped right under his bat outside off stump.
regular bounce this time, to a length delivery outside off, and Stirling's cut is bottom edged, the ball landing at his own feet.
a mixed bag from Jongwe, who now sends down a yorker on off stump. Stirling digs it out to cover.
on a full-ish length, and just outside off. Stirling chops down on the ball to collect a single to third man.
effort ball from the young quick, and Wilson is slightly hurried as he stands at the crease and jams his bat quickly down in defence.

past the outside edge! Wilson was aiming for a little glide down to third man, and the shot was on with the ball outside off stump. But it just did a little more than he expected, and he played inside the line of it.
the spinning ball beats Stirling's flashing drive outside off stump, but it's started wide and gone even further with the spin. Called wide.
straighter this time, and Stirling hits the drive - but Raza dives at extra cover to stop it.
past the edge again! Stirling wanted to cut, but it was too close to him.
chipped in the air ... and landing safe of Waller, charging in from the cover sweeper position. Stirling will be glad he didn't get a better connection on the inside-out drive over cover

this wasn't all that short, but Wilson read the length early and jumped back into his crease to target the vacant midwicket boundary. He had one fielder to beat, inside the circle, and did so with a powerful shot
pushed down flatter, and much closer to the batsman, who digs it out back to the bowler.
Wilson drives at a delivery outside off stump, but he can't pierce the cover ring.
and there's Stirling's fifty! He glances off his pads out into the deep on the leg side. An uncharacteristically patient knock from him, but just what Ireland need.

edged! This was a genuine edge to a delivery outside off, and with no slips in place Mutumbami had a lot of ground to cover with his dive to the right. He did well just to get close to it, leaping full stretch, but the ball was dying on him all the way and he couldn't quite get a glove underneath it.
he's lucky not to be punished for this full toss, which was on the batsman's legs. His paddle goes out to the long leg fielder.
on a length just outside off, and Stirling punches to point.

Mutumbami's caught this one! This may have been an even more difficult chance as well. Jongwe hurled down a short ball which may have caught the batsman by surprise. He was late on the pull, and the ball ballooned in the air towards a third or fourth slip position. Mutumbami sprinted to his right, then dived just in time to get a hand underneath the ball. Great effort, and Zimbabwe have removed the in-batsman!
good delivery first up, on a length and seaming in. And also, I think, keeping a little low. O'Brien gets the bat right down to defend, playing from the crease.
just a little too short on off stump, and the batsman has time to get deep in the crease and cut the ball out to the cover sweeper.

turn and bounce outside off! Mutombodzi let out a yelp and has his head in his hands. Mutumbami didn't hold the ball cleanly after it past the batsman's defensive poke, though I can't tell if there was an edge on it.
certainly no edge on this one, it's come right out of the middle. O'Brien steps down and crunches a drive to wide long off.
pushed rather more gently back to the bowler this time.
O'Brien sweeps, but he sweeps over the ball and it gets caught up in his pad, bouncing towards point.
slashed out to deep cover for one more.
poor delivery, hurled way down the leg side. A big wide
O'Brien tucks the length delivery to the left of midwicket, and just far enough in front of mid-on to allow a quick single.
Wilson rides the bounce on a short ball outside off to collect an easy single down to third man.
another wide, this time as Jongwe flings down a bouncer and it goes down the leg side. Were it not for the line, that was a decently quick, aggressive delivery.
fuller, and straighter. O'Brien clips off his pad for a single out to deep square leg.
another short ball, another wide. Again Jongwe's radar sends it down the leg side.
that's a much better line, cramping Wilson for room on off stump. The batsman defends from the crease, the ball rolling to point.
nicely stopped at straight midwicket. Wilson connected well with his leg glance, but it wasn't far from the fielder, and he was also helped by some friendly bounce.
flicked off the pads, and the fine leg fielder charges in to keep them to one.
turn and bounce outside off, but it's pitched too short and the batsman is easily able to cut the ball out into the deep.
twirled down on middle and off, O'Brien leans his bulky frame forward to defend.
clipped into the leg side, where the fielder sprints in from deep midwicket to keep the batsmen to an honest one.
Wilson comes forward to drive, and pings Raza in the covers.
Tino is really ragging the odd one square off the wicket. Wilson want to sweep this from middle and off, but it's ripped past him and Mutumbami has to stretch to his right to take it.
now Wilson does lay bat on the sweep to get the ball down to fine leg.
tucked into the leg side, the batsman standing deep in the crease. Raza cuts it off.
much too short from Masakadza, and Wilson absolutely hammers a pull out to wide long on.
a quick ball rushes past a flashing cut, and Mutumbami is struck in the chest. He's been in the wars recently, he was struck in the last match as well.
speared in flat and fast on middle, Wilson defends.
a touch of width outside off, but Wilson's cut has a touch of bottom edge about it and it's easily stopped at point.
Masakadza twirls one down full and straight to end the over, and it's met with solid defence.
much too short outside off, and the ball sits up invitingly to be clubbed through the covers.
a much better line and length from the bowler. Wilson steps back and flirts with the idea of a cut shot, but it's really not short enough for it and he wisely withdraws the bat.

great catch! This is smart fielding from Nyumbu. Wilson telegraphed his intention to sweep, and Nyumbu immediately started to move from slip towards the leg side as the ball was bowled. The ball took the top edge, going over Mutumbami, but Nyumbu found himself in exactly the right position to pluck an unlikely catch out of the air above his head. He looks as surprised as anyone!
pushed back down the track to the bowler.
Dockrell bends down and heaves across the line - one can't really call it a sweep - to get the ball out to the fielder at midwicket.
looped down very nicely on middle and leg, the ball gripping and spinning to off as O'Brien stretches forward to defend.
almost done him in the flight! Dockrell stayed back when he should have been forward, and popped the ball uppishly into the leg side.
played more safely this time, running the ball to point.
Dockrell presses forward now, defending back to the bowler.
driven in the air, but powerfully and in the gap! Masakadza floated the ball up to the bat, with mid off up, and Dockrell responded bravely, thrashing the ball down the ground.
much flatter through the air, Dockrell plays for spin but the ball rushes straight on, taking the inside half of his defensive bat.
speared down just outside off stump, and Dockrell angles the ball to backward point.
chopped down into the covers. Dockrell calls immediately for a single, and Raza fires a throw to Mutumbami. The keeper can't hold it cleanly, but the batsman probably would have been safe anyway.
pushed down the leg side, and the ball kisses the pad on its way down.
punched firmly into the covers, straight to the fielder.
floated down on middle and off, Dockrell stretches forward to defend.
cut uppishly to point! Mutombodzi thought there might be a catch to be called for, but it's well short of the fielder.
flighted on middle and off, a classical legspinner's delivery, but it's safely defended by the batsman.
Masakadza stays round the wicket to O'Brien, who nudges the ball carefully into the leg side.

caught by Waller in the deep! O'Brien backed himself to beat the fielder with a slog sweep, and he struck the ball really well - but he got rather too far underneath the ball, and achieved more height than distance. Waller set himself under the catch, and waited ... and waited ... and held on! Advantage Zimbabwe now?
looped down quite slowly outside off. Dockrell comes forward to drive to point.
too short outside off, and with so many men inside the circle there's plenty of space to aim for on the leg side. He chips it out in that direction, and rush back for the third.
nicely full outside off, and McBrine drives to extra cover.

appeal for a stumping! Masakadza got this one to go on with the arm, beating McBrine's outside edge, and Mutumbami had the bails off in a flash. Bowler, slip, short leg and keeper all went up, but the Umpire says he's safe. Nervous times!
edged! And there's no slip in place. Dockrell threw the bat at it, and a thick edge flew through a first/second slip position. Third man charged round, but couldn't cut it off.
and now he rotates the strike with a quick single through backward point. Ireland inch closer.
on a length, landing on middle and off, and McBrine presses forward to defend.
glanced down to fine leg! Wellington Masakadza has a lot of ground to make to cut it off, the ball going very fine, but he manages to keep them to two.
full and straight, and McBrine flicks the ball to Raza at midwicket.
chopped down through the vacant slip region, and they pinch another single.
full and wide outside off, McBrine drives but Waller makes a sharp stop at point.
once again Muzarabani is full and wide. McBrine winds up to drive, and this time he gets it just to the right of the cover point fielder. There's just enough time for a quick single.

caught in the gully! Muzarabani charged in and dug the ball in outside off. He got it to leap up at the batsman, and Dockrell tried to ride the bounce, but couldn't. Nyumbu, who'd moved from slip to gully, tumbled forward to hold on to the catch, and Zimbabwe are buzzing now.
full and straight, and the ball is driven confidently down the ground. But he can't beat Masakadza at mid off, just the single.
slapped hard off the front foot, but Jongwe pulls of a tumbling stop at cover point.
and a dot ball to finish. It was a slower ball, and McBrine read it on the way down. He nudged it to cover, and wanted a single, but the fielder was in too quickly
twirled down on middle and leg, and it's tapped back to the bowler.
a little too straight from Nyumbu, who comes round the wicket to the left-handed Murtagh. The batsman is easily able to work it through the gap at midwicket.
just too straight again, and McBrine flicks to short fine leg for one.
Waller is immediately into action, stopping a flick to leg.
he's found the boundary! With mid on up, Murtagh swung powerfully across the line and over the fielder's head.
clubbed out into the leg side again, but along the ground this time, and they're back for the second.
not quite the yorker, and in fact it's more of a wide half volley. Fortunately for Zimbabwe, he cracks it straight to Waller at point. There's no one on the cover boundary.
a much straighter line, and McBrine taps it back to the bowler.
a huge lbw appeal! He was certainly struck in front, and height wasn't an issue, but it looked to have pitched well outside leg.
full and on the legs again, and McBrine works him through midwicket for one.

that's a great shot for a no. 10! Zimbabwe have a packed off-side field, with only three men on the leg side, and Murtagh whipped the ball through midwicket in fine fashion. It didn't have the legs to reach the boundary, but they don't need it to.
and Jongwe ends with a sharp bouncer to have the batsman ducking for cover. Good, aggressive delivery, and importantly it's on target.
almost chipped back to the bowler! Murtagh wanted to drive down the ground, and almost popped it straight back to the bowler.
too straight again from Nyumbu, and he's flicked to midwicket.
defended back down the track, the ball bang on target.
swept to fine leg! Raza is after it from slip, and hauls it back in.
edged, but it's quite far to Raza's left at slip and he can't reach it.
pitching on middle, spinning towards off, and the batsman leans forward to defend it back down the track.
crunched to the cover boundary! Murtagh is taking his side home here. The ball was wide of off, so the shot was on, but he had to beat a packed inner ring.
fuller and straighter from the bowler, and Murtagh steps forward to drive to mid off.
a huge heave, and he's missed it completely! No need for that shot. Murtagh just slogged across the line at a full one.
Ireland are on the brink now, Murtagh finding the gap between midwicket and mid-on with a firm clip to get three more.
edged! It beats the keeper, it beats a diving short third man, and that's the game!
